tool.name: OpenFields

param.name: config_read
param.dialogReference: The config file used to populate the parameters and read other settings. It is created using the Settings tool. The last config file written with Settings is the default.
param.pythonReference: When the tool is opened, this is read from config_location.txt, located in the same folder as the toolbox. When this tool finishs it overwrites config_location.txt with the value in config_read.

param.name: parcel_layer
param.dialogReference: Tax parcel polygon layer. This should be the only layer that features are selected from. Must contain parcel ID field, and deeded acreage field if that option is selected.

param.name: manual_acreage
param.dialogReference: Deeded acreage for selected parcel. Will only be available if one parcel is selected. Overrides deeded acreage field. If left blank, deeded acreage field will be used if selected. Otherwise, GIS acreage will be the default.
param.pythonReference: Calculates the ratio of the GIS acres to deeded acres, then uses that ratio to find the deeded acres for each resulting polygon.

param.name: landuse_layer
param.dialogReference: Land use polygon layer. Must contain land use field. Must cover entire area of selected parcels.

param.name: soil_layer
param.dialogReference: Soil polygon layer. Must contain soil type field. Must cover entire area of selected parcels.

param.name: parcel_field
param.dialogReference: Unqiue ID for parcels. The field type can be numeric or text. Can include or exclude dashes '-'. When writing to a txt file, the dashes are removed.

param.name: landuse_field
param.dialogReference: Land use abreviation. The field type can be numeric or text, but text is recommended. For txt output, values in the land use field correspond to the land use codes specified in the Settings tool.

param.name: soil_field
param.dialogReference: Soil type with letters and numbers. The field type can be numeric or text, but text is recommended. Should be in format 123X1. The txt file splits the soil type into two parts at the letter. If no number is given after the letter, the default is 1. If no letter is given either, the default is A1. 'W' is also accepted.

param.name: output_folder
param.dialogReference: The folder where the csv, txt, and/or shapefile will be written.

param.name: file_name
param.dialogReference: Base name of txt, csv and shapefile. Default is "output". Do not include extension.
param.pythonReference: This is not included in the config file, so it will need to be changed each time.

tool.summary: This tool intersects the selected parcels with land use and soil layers and writes every unique section to a txt, csv, and/or shapefile. Options are included for a flood debasement layer and deeded acreage field, which are set in the Settings tool. Manual acreage can be specified in this tool if only one parcel is selected.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool intersects the selected parcels with land use and soil layers and writes every unique section to a txt, csv, and/or shapefile. Options are included for a flood debasement layer and deeded acreage field, which are set in the Settings tool. Manual acreage can be specified in this tool if only one parcel is selected.
